flexibility and restraint
learn to turn imagination away from
apprehension and into useful channels
determined to act wisely in minor
matters in order to store up courage for
the major issues of our lives
we use our heads to get the greatest
good from our own gifts and abilities
refusing ourselves the weakening
privileges of dreaming
avoiding responsibilities following the
line of least resistance and acting
childishly
success for any sane adult is exactly
equivalent to doing one's best
what the best may be what its farthest
reaches may include
we can discover only by freeing
ourselves completely from the will to
fail
